docs.snippet: In opening statements of government’s case to block the AT&T-Time Warner merger, the two sides offered starkly different visions of the TV industry.

headline.print_headline: AT&T Antitrust Trial Offers Dueling Views of TV’s Future

docs.snippet: German business leaders are expressing concerns that President Donald Trump's 25 percent tariff on imported steel could affect the auto industry in the South.

headline.main: Some Fear Steel Tariff Could Hurt Auto Industry in the South

docs.snippet: At the Oscars, Ms. Nyong’o and Mr. Nanjiani, stars who are also immigrants, made a pointed reference on behalf of so-called Dreamers.

docs.snippet: The European Union began a study on Monday on whether the import tariffs imposed by U.S. President Donald Trump warranted action to prevent predominantly Asian producers flooding Europe with steel.

headline.print_headline: EU Starts Study Into Possible Steel Import Limits
headline.main: EU Starts Study Into Possible Steel Import Limits

docs.snippet: Asian shares fell on Wednesday after Wall Street was knocked hard by concerns about tighter controls on the tech industry, denting a brief global equities recovery driven by hopes that the risk of a U.S.-China trade war was easing.

headline.print_headline: Asian Shares Skid as US Tech Firms Face More Scrutiny
headline.main: Asian Shares Skid as US Tech Firms Face More Scrutiny

docs.snippet: With passage of an enormous budget bill, the GOP-controlled Congress all but wrapped up its legislating for the year. But will it be enough to convince voters to give Republicans another term at the helm?

headline.print_headline: Will GOP Accomplishments in Congress Be Enough for Voters?
headline.main: Will GOP Accomplishments in Congress Be Enough for Voters?
